intro: Ctenium indicum, commonly known as Indian ctenium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and compound leaves with a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of Asia, including India, and thrives in moist, temperate climates. Ctenium indicum is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
